result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Lee Isom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *5/12/2022  Honorable Carolina Maria Stark signed Decision and Order. Sentence credit amended to 241 days on count one.*  Consecutive to: Count 2; credit for 9 days time served

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample. Pay DNA surcharge to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during period of Extended Supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED payment of all other costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No possession or use of controlled substances or materials associated with drug dealing.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at a time.
- Continue current treatment, and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1; credit for 0 days time served

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. cmc
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment, count 1. (Return address: Samuel Isom, #328230, Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 700, Waupun, WI 53963).
Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (28 pages) commencing OCTOBER 29, 2018 by FRANCINE O'CLAIRE.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel Lee Isom
Current: 2535 N 28th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 07-30-2019)
Prior: 2535 N 50th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,477.00 entered as ordered by the court on 01/17/19 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 07/01/21. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:
HAYES $1477
Received, signed, and filed: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to count 2, credit for 9 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to count 1, credit for zero days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Continue current treatment, and/or counseling as determined by agent.
No possession or use of controlled substances or materials associated with drug dealing.
No possession of more than one cell phone at a time.
Obtain/maintain employment.
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay DNA surcharge to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived payment of all other costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Appeal rights given.
Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS CHARGED IN THE AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint and statements in court as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant provided poof of treatment and full-time emplyoment.  No action taken as to bail.  Case remains calendared for jury trial 10/29/18 in branch 24.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Defendant to provide proof of treatment and employment.  Case adjourned to branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered LEVEL 4 supervision. All other terms and conditions previously set as to bail to remain in effect. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.

Court is advised that Defense counsel will be unavailable for Jury Trial as scheduled. Defense requests that matter be adjourned. State does not object to an adjournment. Case remains calendared in branch 24.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Marissa Burtch. Case recalled. Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Case remains calendared as previously set.

Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Tom Hayes, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $70.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Samuel Lee Isom in court with attorney Tom Hayes.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Decision. Court reviews Defense's Motion to Suppress. Court DENIES motion. State motions to increase bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court denies the State's motion in part. 
Court orders Justice Point monitoring modified to INCLUDE random URINE SCREENS.
Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Scheduling Order signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 16, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 17, 2018 at 08:30 am.

State is requesting an adjournment for further testimony.  Case adjourned for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
